intro: Tithymalus pseudopeplus, commonly known as false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Tithymalus pseudopeplus is often considered a weed due to its aggressive growth habit and ability to spread rapidly.
